title: Chinese embassy funds 18.1 million kwacha international investment forum
description: On June 2, 2015, the Chinese embassy granted 18.1 million kwacha to to the Malawi Government through Ministry of Trade and Industry for the Malawi Investment Forum (MIF). The grant is for the international investment forum in Malawi, according to MOFCOM and the Malawi News Agency. The event will take place at Bingu International Conference Centre (BICC) in Lilongwe. Over 300 investors from all over the world attended the forum.  The forum was held June 29 - 30, 2015.
combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
Chinese embassy funds 18.1 million kwacha international investment forum

# Description
On June 2, 2015, the Chinese embassy granted 18.1 million kwacha to to the Malawi Government through Ministry of Trade and Industry for the Malawi Investment Forum (MIF). The grant is for the international investment forum in Malawi, according to MOFCOM and the Malawi News Agency. The event will take place at Bingu International Conference Centre (BICC) in Lilongwe. Over 300 investors from all over the world attended the forum.  The forum was held June 29 - 30, 2015.
justification: Funding for an international investment forum without specific environmental or energy-related focus
evidence: Grant for Malawi Investment Forum, no direct environmental or energy transition impacts mentioned

title: 3 Chinese firms provide RM900,000 in-kind and cash grant for flood relief
description: In January 2015, three Chinese companies (CSR Corp, China Railway Construction Corporation, Beijing Urban Construction Group) provided flood relief assistance in the form of RM900,000 and 10,000 candles to Malaysia. This project is also linked to projects #38131, #38133, and #38135.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
3 Chinese firms provide RM900,000 in-kind and cash grant for flood relief

# Description
In January 2015, three Chinese companies (CSR Corp, China Railway Construction Corporation, Beijing Urban Construction Group) provided flood relief assistance in the form of RM900,000 and 10,000 candles to Malaysia. This project is also linked to projects #38131, #38133, and #38135.
justification: Project is focused on emergency relief and humanitarian assistance without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Flood relief assistance, cash grant, and candles provided for emergency response

title: Chinese government provided 10 million RMB worth of flood relief supplies (first batch) (Linked to #73616)
description: In January 2015, China donated 2500 tents worth 10 million RMB to Malaysia for flood relief.  The second batch of relief supplies, also worth 10 million RMB, was provided in July 2015, captured in #73616.

justification: Project is humanitarian aid for disaster relief with no direct environmental or energy transition impact

title: Chinese Embassy donates RM20,000 of school materials to Kelantan Independent Chinese Secondary School
description: On January 11, 2015, the Chinese embassy in Malaysia donated RM20,000 in school materials to the Kelantan Independent Chinese Secondary School as part of flood relief efforts. The donation included 486 school uniforms, shoes, and socks, as well as 700 Chinese books.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates RM20,000 of school materials to Kelantan Independent Chinese Secondary School

# Description
On January 11, 2015, the Chinese embassy in Malaysia donated RM20,000 in school materials to the Kelantan Independent Chinese Secondary School as part of flood relief efforts. The donation included 486 school uniforms, shoes, and socks, as well as 700 Chinese books.
justification: Project involves donation of school materials for educational purposes without direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of school uniforms, shoes, socks, and Chinese books to support education

title: Hanban provides grant for establishment of Confucius Institute at SEGi University
description: On November 23, 2015, the Confucius Institute at SEGi University was officially established as a collaboration with Hainan Normal University. It was then officially inaugurated on December 20, 2015. The Confucius Institute at SEGi University is located in the city of Kota Damansara and it offers HSK examinations, Mandarin lessons plus seminars on Chinese culture and about China to members of the public.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban provides grant for establishment of Confucius Institute at SEGi University

# Description
On November 23, 2015, the Confucius Institute at SEGi University was officially established as a collaboration with Hainan Normal University. It was then officially inaugurated on December 20, 2015. The Confucius Institute at SEGi University is located in the city of Kota Damansara and it offers HSK examinations, Mandarin lessons plus seminars on Chinese culture and about China to members of the public.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Institute offering language lessons and cultural seminars

title: ICBC and China Eximbank provide $800 million overseas investment loan for acquisition of Edra Global Energy Berhad
description: In 2015, ICBC and China Eximbank provided a $800 million 1-year, syndicated, bridge, overseas investment loan to Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd (EDRA) — a subsidiary of China General Nuclear Power Corporation (CGNPC) — to facilitate its $2.3 billion acquisition of Edra Global Energy Berhad (also known as Edra Company of Malaysia). ICBC served as the mandated lead arranger of the syndicated loan. The loan carried a 1 year maturity, but its interest rate and grace period are unknown. CGNPC provided a corporate guarantee in support of the loan.   On November 23, 2015, 1MDB — a Malaysian state investment fund — agreed to sell its energy business (Edra Global Energy Berhad) in a $2.3 billion cash deal to China General Nuclear Power Corporation (CGN) in order to reduce its indebtedness and restore investor confidence. Then, on March 23, 2016, Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd (EDRA) became a subsidiary of China General Nuclear Power Corporation (CGNPC) following the successful acquisition of Edra Global Energy Berhad’s operating companies by CGNPC and its subsidiaries for RM 9.83 billion in cash. CGN Group also assumed all the relevant gross debt and cash of these operating companies. Following the acquisition, Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd became the new holding company of these operating companies, which include Edra Solar Sdn Bhd, Edra Energy Sdn Bhd, Powertek Energy Sdn Bhd, Jimah Teknik Sdn Bhd, Jimah O&M Sdn Bhd, Mastika Lagenda Sdn Bhd and Tiara Tanah Sdn Bhd.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 中国广核集团收购马来西亚埃德拉公司 项目 or 中广核Edra电站项目 or 埃德拉项目. 2. Prior to its acquisition, Edra Global Energy Berhad (also known as Edra Company of Malaysia) was the power asset arm of 1 Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB). The sale of IMDB's energy assets (more than RM17 billion, equity and debt assumed) was designed to significantly reduce 1MDB's debts.3. Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd — a wholly owned subsidiary of China General Nuclear Power Corporation, Ltd — is a company that was incorporated in Malaysia on November 5, 2015. It is an international independent power producer, controlling a diversified portfolio of quality power generation assets across a range of technologies. Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd, together with its subsidiaries and associates, have a portfolio of 13 gas-fired and coal-fired power and desalination plants in Malaysia, Bangladesh, Egypt, Pakistan and United Arab Emirates with a gross installed capacity under management of 6,619 MW and an effective capacity of 5,594 MW.4. In 2015, Malaysia's then-Prime Minister Najib Razak was accused of channelling over RM 2.67 billion (approximately $700 million) from 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) — a government-run investment fund — to his personal bank accounts. The event triggered widespread criticism among Malaysians, with many calling for Najib Razak's resignation –- including Mahathir Mohamad, one of Najib's predecessors as prime minister, who later defeated Najib in the 2018 general election and returned to power. Razak reportedly asked Low Taek Jho (commonly referred to as Jho Low) to negotiate with the Chinese Government to resolve the 1MDB crisis. Jho Low is also accused of being the mastermind of an elaborate effort to defraud 1MDB. In October 2016, Interpol published a red notice at Singapore's request to locate and arrest Low in an investigation related to 1MDB scandal. Then, in November 2020, Al-Jazeera reported that Low was currently living in Macau, in a house owned by a senior member of the Chinese Communist Party.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
ICBC and China Eximbank provide $800 million overseas investment loan for acquisition of Edra Global Energy Berhad

# Description
In 2015, ICBC and China Eximbank provided a $800 million 1-year, syndicated, bridge, overseas investment loan to Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd (EDRA) — a subsidiary of China General Nuclear Power Corporation (CGNPC) — to facilitate its $2.3 billion acquisition of Edra Global Energy Berhad (also known as Edra Company of Malaysia). ICBC served as the mandated lead arranger of the syndicated loan. The loan carried a 1 year maturity, but its interest rate and grace period are unknown. CGNPC provided a corporate guarantee in support of the loan.   On November 23, 2015, 1MDB — a Malaysian state investment fund — agreed to sell its energy business (Edra Global Energy Berhad) in a $2.3 billion cash deal to China General Nuclear Power Corporation (CGN) in order to reduce its indebtedness and restore investor confidence. Then, on March 23, 2016, Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd (EDRA) became a subsidiary of China General Nuclear Power Corporation (CGNPC) following the successful acquisition of Edra Global Energy Berhad’s operating companies by CGNPC and its subsidiaries for RM 9.83 billion in cash. CGN Group also assumed all the relevant gross debt and cash of these operating companies. Following the acquisition, Edra Power Holdings Sdn Bhd became the new holding company of these operating companies, which include Edra Solar Sdn Bhd, Edra Energy Sdn Bhd, Powertek Energy Sdn Bhd, Jimah Teknik Sdn Bhd, Jimah O&M Sdn Bhd, Mastika Lagenda Sdn Bhd and Tiara Tanah Sdn Bhd.
justification: The acquisition primarily involves energy companies with a focus on renewable energy, including solar power, under the China General Nuclear Power Corporation (CGNPC), which is a major player in low-carbon energy.
evidence: Acquisition of Edra Global Energy Berhad by CGNPC, which includes Edra Solar Sdn Bhd and other energy companies, indicating a focus on renewable energy and low-carbon energy projects.

title: China Eximbank, China Construction Bank, and Agricultural Bank of China provide $664 million syndicated loan for Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park Integrated Steel Project (Linked to Project ID#62338 and #62339)
description: In November 2015, China Eximbank, China Construction Bank, and the Agricultural Bank of China signed a $664 million syndicated loan agreement with Alliance Steel (M) SDN BHD [also known as Alliance Steel or 联合钢铁（大马）集团公司] — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of Guangxi Beibu Gulf International Port Group Co., Ltd. and Guangxi Shenglong Metallurgical Co., Ltd — for the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park Integrated Steel Project. The borrowing terms of this loan are unknown. In November 2015, China Eximbank, China Construction Bank, and the Agricultural Bank of China also signed an RMB 2 billion syndicated loan agreement with Alliance Steel (M) SDN BHD for the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park Integrated Steel Project. The borrowing terms of this loan are also unknown. The $664 million loan is captured via Project ID#62336 and the RMB 2 billion loan is captured via Project ID#62338. The borrower purchased credit insurance from Sinosure for these two loans. The total cost of the project was $1.4 billion and it was financed with a mix of debt and equity. The equity portion was provided through a $423 million direct investment by Guangxi Beibu Gulf International Port Group Co., Ltd. (captured via Project ID#62339).  The purpose of the project was to construct a steel production plant — with the capacity to produce 3.5 million tons of steel per year — in the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park, which is located in in Pahang state on Malaysia's east coast. The plant covers an area of approximately 4,200 acres and it is designed to produce steel bars and wire rods for the ASEAN region. Upon the completion of the project, the plant was expected to generate 400 local jobs.   MCC22 Group Corporation Ltd. (MCC20), a subsidiary of China Metallurgical Group Corporation (MCC), was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The project officially commenced on December 23, 2014. However, the first syndicated loan disbursement did not take place until October 25, 2016. The steel plant was put into operation on May 8, 2018. An official project completion and commissioning ceremony was held on June 15, 2019. The originally anticipated project commencement and completion dates were June 2, 2016 and December 31, 2017, respectively. Upon completion of the project, the steel plant had created 2,700 local jobs.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the 3.5 Million Tons of Integrated Steel Project in Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park (MCKIP), the 3.5 million tons of steel project in Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park, and the Kuantan Steel Project. The Chinese project title is 马中关丹产业园350万吨钢铁项目 or 马来西亚关丹产业园钢铁厂项目 or 联合钢铁项目.2. Guangxi Beibu Gulf International Port Group is a wholly state-owned company under the People's Government of Guangxi. Guangxi Shenglong Metallurgical Co., Ltd is a joint-stock private enterprise owned by Fujian Wugang Group and private entrepreneurs from Fujian Province. Guangxi Beibu Gulf International Port Group Co., Ltd. and Guangxi Shenglong Metallurgical Co., Ltd established Alliance Steel (M) SDN BHD as a joint venture in April 2014.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Eximbank, China Construction Bank, and Agricultural Bank of China provide $664 million syndicated loan for Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park Integrated Steel Project (Linked to Project ID#62338 and #62339)

# Description
In November 2015, China Eximbank, China Construction Bank, and the Agricultural Bank of China signed a $664 million syndicated loan agreement with Alliance Steel (M) SDN BHD [also known as Alliance Steel or 联合钢铁（大马）集团公司] — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of Guangxi Beibu Gulf International Port Group Co., Ltd. and Guangxi Shenglong Metallurgical Co., Ltd — for the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park Integrated Steel Project. The borrowing terms of this loan are unknown. In November 2015, China Eximbank, China Construction Bank, and the Agricultural Bank of China also signed an RMB 2 billion syndicated loan agreement with Alliance Steel (M) SDN BHD for the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park Integrated Steel Project. The borrowing terms of this loan are also unknown. The $664 million loan is captured via Project ID#62336 and the RMB 2 billion loan is captured via Project ID#62338. The borrower purchased credit insurance from Sinosure for these two loans. The total cost of the project was $1.4 billion and it was financed with a mix of debt and equity. The equity portion was provided through a $423 million direct investment by Guangxi Beibu Gulf International Port Group Co., Ltd. (captured via Project ID#62339).  The purpose of the project was to construct a steel production plant — with the capacity to produce 3.5 million tons of steel per year — in the Malaysia-China Kuantan Industrial Park, which is located in in Pahang state on Malaysia's east coast. The plant covers an area of approximately 4,200 acres and it is designed to produce steel bars and wire rods for the ASEAN region. Upon the completion of the project, the plant was expected to generate 400 local jobs.   MCC22 Group Corporation Ltd. (MCC20), a subsidiary of China Metallurgical Group Corporation (MCC), was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The project officially commenced on December 23, 2014. However, the first syndicated loan disbursement did not take place until October 25, 2016. The steel plant was put into operation on May 8, 2018. An official project completion and commissioning ceremony was held on June 15, 2019. The originally anticipated project commencement and completion dates were June 2, 2016 and December 31, 2017, respectively. Upon completion of the project, the steel plant had created 2,700 local jobs.
justification: Steel production is a high-emission industrial process with significant environmental impact, primarily contributing to fossil fuel dependency and carbon emissions
evidence: Steel production plant with 3.5 million tons/year capacity, no mention of energy efficiency or low-carbon technologies

title: China Development Bank provides RMB 800 million loan for Negeri Sembilan Glass Factory Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#62383)
description: In January 2015, Zhuzhou Kibing Group Co., Ltd. (also known as Kibing Group or 株洲旗滨集团股份有限公司) — a large enterprise group in China that mainly produces high-end glass products such as high-quality float glass, energy-saving glass, solar glass and ultra-thin glass, with production bases in Hunan, Fujian, Guangdong and Zhejiang provinces — announced plans to construct a new float line (glass factory) in Malaysia. It established a special purpose vehicle and wholly-owned subsidiary called Kibing Group (M) Sdn Bhd [also known as Kibing Group (Malaysia) Co., Ltd. or 旗滨集团（马来西亚）有限公司] for this purpose on October 23, 2014. Then, on May 16, 2015, Kibing Group disclosed that it would invest RMB 1.175 billion in the construction of a glass factory — with two production lines and the capacity to produce 1400 tons per day of clear float glass 3~19mm thick — in the city of Seremban within the district of Seremban and the state of Negeri Sembilan.  In November 2015, Kibing Group applied for two loans on behalf of Kibing Group (M) Sdn Bhd: an RMB 800 million loan with a two year maturity from the Fujian Branch of China Development Bank (CDB) and a $6.5 million (approximately RM 24 million) loan with a one year maturity from Bank Of China (Malaysia) Berhad. Subsequent financial statements from Kibing Group indicate that the CDB loan was approved and Kibing Group issued a corporate guarantee in support of the CDB loan. However, it is unclear if the Bank of China loan was approved. United Overseas Bank may have also issued an RMB 24 million loan to Kibing Group (M) Sdn Bhd in support of the project. The first glass production line was put into operation on March 20, 2017 and the second glass production line was put into operation in June 2017. The CDB loan commitment is captured via Project ID#62461 and the Bank of China loan is captured (as a pledge) via Project ID#62383
staff_comments: 1: The Chinese project title is LOW-E在线镀膜和高档多元化玻璃生产线的.2: The official commitment (CDB loan agreement) date is unknown. For the time being, AidData has set the commitment year to the year in which the CDB loan application was submitted (2015).  3: Financial reporting by Kibing Group suggests that CDB may have ultimately issued two separate loans for this project (collectively worth RMB 800 million): a $70 million loan and an RMB 320 million. This issue requires further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Development Bank provides RMB 800 million loan for Negeri Sembilan Glass Factory Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#62383)

# Description
In January 2015, Zhuzhou Kibing Group Co., Ltd. (also known as Kibing Group or 株洲旗滨集团股份有限公司) — a large enterprise group in China that mainly produces high-end glass products such as high-quality float glass, energy-saving glass, solar glass and ultra-thin glass, with production bases in Hunan, Fujian, Guangdong and Zhejiang provinces — announced plans to construct a new float line (glass factory) in Malaysia. It established a special purpose vehicle and wholly-owned subsidiary called Kibing Group (M) Sdn Bhd [also known as Kibing Group (Malaysia) Co., Ltd. or 旗滨集团（马来西亚）有限公司] for this purpose on October 23, 2014. Then, on May 16, 2015, Kibing Group disclosed that it would invest RMB 1.175 billion in the construction of a glass factory — with two production lines and the capacity to produce 1400 tons per day of clear float glass 3~19mm thick — in the city of Seremban within the district of Seremban and the state of Negeri Sembilan.  In November 2015, Kibing Group applied for two loans on behalf of Kibing Group (M) Sdn Bhd: an RMB 800 million loan with a two year maturity from the Fujian Branch of China Development Bank (CDB) and a $6.5 million (approximately RM 24 million) loan with a one year maturity from Bank Of China (Malaysia) Berhad. Subsequent financial statements from Kibing Group indicate that the CDB loan was approved and Kibing Group issued a corporate guarantee in support of the CDB loan. However, it is unclear if the Bank of China loan was approved. United Overseas Bank may have also issued an RMB 24 million loan to Kibing Group (M) Sdn Bhd in support of the project. The first glass production line was put into operation on March 20, 2017 and the second glass production line was put into operation in June 2017. The CDB loan commitment is captured via Project ID#62461 and the Bank of China loan is captured (as a pledge) via Project ID#62383
justification: Project focuses on glass production without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of glass factory producing float glass, no specific energy efficiency or renewable energy components mentioned

title: China Eximbank provides $62 million loan for Solar Cell and Solar Module Production Line Project (Linked to Project ID#62478)
description: In January 2015, the U.S. Department of Commerce finalized anti-dumping duty rates of 52% and anti-subsidy rates of 39% on the import of Chinese solar panels. Two months later, in March 2015, Jinko Solar Holding Co., Ltd. (晶科太阳能) announced plans to construct a solar cell and module manufacturing facility in Penang State within Malaysia. It reportedly decided to build the facility in order to avoid the imposition of countervailing duties and anti-dumping duties in the U.S. Then, on August 3, 2015, China Eximbank issued two separate loans to Jinko Solar Holding Co., Ltd. (晶科太阳能) for the Solar Cell and Solar Module Production Line Project: an RMB 50 million loan (captured via Project ID#62478) for near-term working capital and a $62 million loan (captured via Project ID#62477) for long-term fixed assets and mid-term working capital. The borrowing terms of these loan are unknown. The borrower was to use the proceeds from the two loans to support a solar cell and solar module production facility (factory) in the Perai Free Industrial Zone (Perai FIZ) within the city of Seberang Perai and the state of Penang. The factory was officially inaugurated and put into operation on May 26, 2015. It had an initial designed annual production capacity of 500MW for solar cells and 450MW for solar modules and it now employs more than 5,000 people (nearly 80% of whom are locally recruited). After the factory was put into operation, it underwent several expansion phases. Phase 2 commenced in January 2016 and ended in June 2016. Phase 3 began during the second half of 2016. As of the end of 2017, the project had achieved 1700MW and 1300MW of solar cell capacity and solar module capacity, respectively. As of the end of 2018, the project had constructed 7 separate factories in the Perai FIZ and achieved 3500MW and 3000MW of solar cell capacity and solar module capacity, respectively. In 2020, a new implementing Agency, Risen Energy, joined the project. In 2020, a new implementing Agency, Risen Energy, joined the project.
staff_comments: 1: The Chinese project title is 马来西亚光伏太阳能电池片及光伏太阳能组件生产线项目 or 马来西亚槟城太阳能电池片项目 or 晶科能源马来西亚槟城项目. This project is also known as the Malaysia Photovoltaic Solar Cell and Photovoltaic Solar Module Production Line Project. 2: JinkoSolar Holding Co., Ltd. is currently the world's largest solar panel manufacturer, shipping 11.4 GW of modules in 2018. Headquartered in Shanghai, China, the company started out as a wafer manufacturer in 2006 and went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2010.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Eximbank provides $62 million loan for Solar Cell and Solar Module Production Line Project (Linked to Project ID#62478)

# Description
In January 2015, the U.S. Department of Commerce finalized anti-dumping duty rates of 52% and anti-subsidy rates of 39% on the import of Chinese solar panels. Two months later, in March 2015, Jinko Solar Holding Co., Ltd. (晶科太阳能) announced plans to construct a solar cell and module manufacturing facility in Penang State within Malaysia. It reportedly decided to build the facility in order to avoid the imposition of countervailing duties and anti-dumping duties in the U.S. Then, on August 3, 2015, China Eximbank issued two separate loans to Jinko Solar Holding Co., Ltd. (晶科太阳能) for the Solar Cell and Solar Module Production Line Project: an RMB 50 million loan (captured via Project ID#62478) for near-term working capital and a $62 million loan (captured via Project ID#62477) for long-term fixed assets and mid-term working capital. The borrowing terms of these loan are unknown. The borrower was to use the proceeds from the two loans to support a solar cell and solar module production facility (factory) in the Perai Free Industrial Zone (Perai FIZ) within the city of Seberang Perai and the state of Penang. The factory was officially inaugurated and put into operation on May 26, 2015. It had an initial designed annual production capacity of 500MW for solar cells and 450MW for solar modules and it now employs more than 5,000 people (nearly 80% of whom are locally recruited). After the factory was put into operation, it underwent several expansion phases. Phase 2 commenced in January 2016 and ended in June 2016. Phase 3 began during the second half of 2016. As of the end of 2017, the project had achieved 1700MW and 1300MW of solar cell capacity and solar module capacity, respectively. As of the end of 2018, the project had constructed 7 separate factories in the Perai FIZ and achieved 3500MW and 3000MW of solar cell capacity and solar module capacity, respectively. In 2020, a new implementing Agency, Risen Energy, joined the project. In 2020, a new implementing Agency, Risen Energy, joined the project.
justification: Primary purpose is manufacturing solar cells and modules, directly supporting renewable energy production
evidence: Solar cell and module production facility, annual production capacity of 500MW for solar cells and 450MW for solar modules initially, later expanded to 3500MW and 3000MW respectively
